conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph for both objects A and B.
The two objects start at the same point (same initial velocity).
They intersect again at t2, meaning they are at the same position at this time.
The distance traveled by each object can be found by the area under each curve.
At t1, the area under the curve of object A is greater than that of object B, indicating object A is ahead of object B.
Between t1 and t2, object B gains on object A, as its area under the curve increases more rapidly.
The greatest distance apart occurs when the difference in the areas under the curves is the largest.
This happens at the time when the difference between the areas under the curves of A and B is maximized.
At t1, the distance between A and B is the greatest because after t1, object B begins to catch up with A.
Therefore, the maximum separation occurs just before B starts closing the gap.
The two objects are farthest apart at t1.
The two objects are farthest apart at t1.
